## Key Concepts Learned
- Vector data (Points, lines, polygons)
- CRS (Coordinate Reference Systems)
- Spatial subsetting
- Saptial join
- Geometry operations

## Coding Techniques
- sf package
  - st_read(), st_transform(), st_crs(), st_geometry(), st_drop_geometry()
  - st_buffer(), st_centroid(), st_distance(), st_area(.), st_union(), st_intersection()
  - ggplot() + geom_sf() + theme_void()
  - st_filter(), st_intersects(), st_touches(), st_within(), st_contains(), st_overlaps(), st_disjoint()
  - as.numeric()
  - If no .predicate specified, uses st_intersects
  

## Questions & Challenges
- Practice and try to remember the sf functions

## Connections to Policy
- Training data may under-represent certain areas
- Spatial autocorrelation violates independence assumptions
- Service delivery algorithms may reinforce geographic inequities

## Reflection
- For CRS, measuring areas in latitude/longitude gives wrong answers
- Our mission: Understand spatial patterns to design fairer systems
